alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kit Carson County; Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 19 at 1:31AM MDT until May 19 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT /NOON CDT/ THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT /9 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 001...002...013...014... 027...028...041...042...079...080...081...252...253 AND 254... * Affected Area...In Colorado...Fire Weather Zone 252 Yuma... Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson and Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. In Kansas...Fire Weather Zone 001 Cheyenne...Fire Weather Zone 002 Rawlins...Fire Weather Zone 013 Sherman... Fire Weather Zone 014 Thomas...Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace... Fire Weather Zone 028 Logan...Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. In Nebraska...Fire Weather Zone 079 Dundy...Fire Weather Zone 080 Hitchcock and Fire Weather Zone 081 Red Willow. * Timing...Late this morning through sunset this evening. * Winds...Southwest to west southwest at 20 to 30 mph. Gusts up to 40 mph are possible, mainly in eastern Colorado and adjacent Kansas border counties. * Relative Humidity...As low as 10 to 15 percent. * Temperatures...In the lower to middle 90s. * Impacts...Extreme and unpredictable fire behavior. Any fires that start may rapidly grow and spread out of control. * Additional Information...An abrupt wind shift to the north is expected around or shortly after sunset Thursday along and north of the Kansas/Nebraska border, continuing south across the remainder of the area during the evening. Wind gusts of 30 to 40 mph are expected. First responders fighting any fires should keep in contact with the National Weather Service in Goodland regarding the timing of the wind shift, associated with a cold front.
info.instruction: Outdoor burning is not advised today. Repeating, outdoor burning is not advised. Any fires that start may rapidly grow and spread out of control.
